alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 11 at 3:56AM MST until December 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...POTENT WINTER STORM HEADED FOR THE REGION... .A strong winter storm system will move into the Great Basin tonight, and then track toward southeast Colorado Monday night, and then lift northeast into Nebraska by Tuesday. This track means that significant travel impacts will be possible especially over portions of the northeast plains of Colorado into adjacent western Nebraska and parts of eastern Wyoming. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions may develop over the eastern plains of Colorado as the storm intensifies late Monday night and Tuesday. Strong winds are expected to gust to 50-60 mph, and combined with falling snow create blizzard conditions. There is still considerable uncertainty with regard to eventual storm totals and exactly how far east or west the heavier snow on the plains will be. Thus, anyone planning to travel or those with outdoor livestock interests should pay particular attention to the latest winter storm watches, warnings, and statements from the National Weather Service and your local news media. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches, with up to 18 inches in portions of the northern mountains including the Park, northern Gore, and Medicine Bow Ranges, and portions of Rocky Mountain National Park. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...From 1 PM Monday to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads will become slick and hazardous. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening, Tuesday, and Wednesday commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
